hook.text: Coca-Cola funded research claiming exercise, not diet, was the key to fighting obesity.

buildup.text: Food companies fund nutrition studies to produce results that favor their products.

discovery.text: A review found industry-funded studies were 4 to 8 times more likely to favor the sponsor's product.

twist.text: The funding doesn't always cause fraudâ€”but it shapes which questions get asked and how results get framed.

climax.text: Always check who paid for a nutrition study. The funding source often predicts the conclusion.

punchline.text: Follow the money, then read the study.

quiz.question: How much more likely are industry-funded studies to favor the sponsor?
